content.description: people will find a reason not to believe in any given day

content.scripture: 2 And it came to pass that from this time forth there began to be lyings sent forth among the people, by Satan, to harden their hearts, to the intent that they might not believe in those signs and wonders which they had seen; but notwithstanding these lyings and deceivings the more part of the people did believe, and were converted unto the Lord.
content.description: people will find a reason not to believe in any given day
Why people aree always crediting satan? really what possible reason would have in saying repent and believe in christ
Even with a miracle right in front of people sometimes they wiwll not believe.

content.scripture: 12 And thus Laman and Lemuel, being the eldest, did murmur against their father. And they did murmur because they knew not the dealings of that God who had created them.
content.description: How often are we like Laman and Lemuel? Where we murmur simply because we do not trust Heavenly Father and his dealings with us. The solution seems here to morre fully underrstand our heavenly father and then we will be less adapt to murmur.
If you love people who arrea in trouble pray for them in their trails

content.scripture: 11 And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
content.description: The Lord is exacty aware of were paul is and what paul is about to do. He strengths paul and confirms his testimony before death. He also knows us what we about to do, and if we followw him it can be exactly according to god"s plans

content.scripture: 11 And the night following the Lord stood by him, and said, Be of good cheer, Paul: for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.
content.description: The lord does nothing saves he does it for the benefit of us down here on this world.

Christ is merciful, even here he says he will gather them under his wing, even after all the wickedness. it is also important to note thta gather is a very positive term that the lord uses. He will gather his sheep, and people his people.

The Lord is merciful to those who beleive. The new Testment and Bom of mormon are full of examples like this. The Lord is specifically compassionate to those who specifacally ask. This could be a result of asking requiring faith.
Misunderstanding the scriputes does not lead to true conversion

content.scripture: 12 Now behold, this Lachoneus, the governor, was a just man, and could not be frightened by the demands and the threatenings of a robber; therefore he did not hearken to the epistle of Giddianhi, the governor of the robbers, but he did cause that his people should cry unto the Lord for strength against the time that the robbers should come down against them.
content.description: When oppositionarise be sure to call unto the lord immediatly

When Lehi starts his vision of the tree of life a man in a white robe bids him to follow him. It isnt long after that he finds himself in a dark and dreary waste. He then prays to find a way out, when he does he can see a large and spacious field. I beleive this fits with the premortal life and it is not until we pray that we can find our way out to see the goall or eternal life.

content.scripture: 12 Now behold, this Lachoneus, the governor, was a just man, and could not be frightened by the demands and the threatenings of a robber; therefore he did not hearken to the epistle of Giddianhi, the governor of the robbers, but he did cause that his people should cry unto the Lord for strength against the time that the robbers should come down against them.
content.description: Satan is without purpose, and if you are lead by him you also have no purpose or direction. Hell at least partly includes limibo of not knowing where to go

content.scripture: 12 Now behold, this Lachoneus, the governor, was a just man, and could not be frightened by the demands and the threatenings of a robber; therefore he did not hearken to the epistle of Giddianhi, the governor of the robbers, but he did cause that his people should cry unto the Lord for strength against the time that the robbers should come down against them.
content.description: This is how we should think of ourselves in relation to jesus christ our lord and our savior. We do not have power in our seleves to save us, only through christ. We should aim to put in first and please him, and do it accorinding to the rule

content.scripture: I think that it is important to note that just partaking of the love of god or the atonement is not enough to stay, we must fall down and not let our hearts care out the world opinon of us if we are to make it.

4 Wherefore, whoso believeth in God might with surety hope for a better world, yea, even a place at the right hand of God, which hope cometh of faith, maketh an anchor to the souls of men, which would make them sure and steadfast, always abounding in good works, being led to glorify God
content.description: The faith in eternal life with god, $maketh an anchor to the souls of men$ allows men to have the strength to be steadfast. Which means we need to strengthen our faith in that.

Here moroni is proving that through faith all things are possible. He later goes on to tell how thouhg the brother of jared saw Jehovah. I believe Moroni is even saying that we to could not be kept within the veil if we would but have faith. How cool is that?
This is a great example and definition of perfect faith.  Abraham did not doubt even when the world said he should, rather agianst all odds he decided that he would believe
It was not until after sthephen had hands laid upon him that the account of miracles began. He was a great man of faith that had the holy ghost. Follows the pattern in this church
This is a great scripture about the ressurection. It states that we can receive a body like christ, through the power of christ how cool is that

I see the principle here that sometimes it takes time to get to the burdens we are called to bear, bu in the process of doing those things the lord will bless them with the stregth to accomplish them.
Nehpi knows god and he knows that being struch down by inquity is a possiblity here. Especially since he is is from old testament times.
We must school ourselves like a professional athlete schools his body, by doing this we should be in a better posistion to have eternal life

Nephi in these verses expresses that the lord works same today, tommorow, and yesterday, becuase he like the prohets of old can recieve revelation concerning christ. he also uses the prophets of old to teach his brethen. The scriptures are valuable in teaching both principles.

Pual paints a very clear picture of way immorality is wrong using reasons not usally used. If we are members in christ would we make a part of christ prostitute. Nope! His is our caregiver and we should not defile him or his body which we are a part of.

The early apostles used lots and prayers in order to determine which apostle was to be chossen next. Makes me wonder if it is not so much as important of how we seek revelation, but the desire of our heart, what we ask for and the faith that is present. Prayer is a common factor though.

Nephi here gets excited about lehis vision and knows exactly where to go to find more infomartion and know more fully. In contrast to Laman and Lemuel in chapter 15 who are frustrated becuase they dont know the meaning of the vision because they $knew not the dealings of the god who had created them$. Nephi knew through his revelation and also becuase he knew Gods history or in other words the scripture

content.scripture: 21 Behold, I say unto you that whoso believeth in Christ, doubting nothing, whatsoever he shall ask the Father in the name of Christ it shall be granted him; and this promise is unto all, even unto the ends of the earth.
content.description: Moroni Goe sout of his way to mention that the promise is to all the earth, meaning if we have faith nothing doubting we to can recieve. I fits with the chapter idea of mircles only stop when doubt increases.

I love this thought because it is mine exactly. I think it would be quite odd to live in zion and then havee to sue. I would rathere just be wrong becuase thus saith the lord vengence is mine and i will repay. We should work on having charity first.

content.scripture: 2 O Lord, thou hast said that we must be encompassed about by the floods. Now behold, O Lord, and do not be angry with thy servant because of his weakness before thee; for we know that thou art holy and dwellest in the heavens, and that we are unworthy before thee; because of the fall our natures have become evil continually; nevertheless, O Lord, thou hast given us a commandment that we must call upon thee, that from thee we may receive according to our desires.
content.description: The Lord is so mericful to everyone of us. We are all fallen and yet he has commanded us to  call upon him for strength. He wants us to ask for help that is how much he loves us

I thought as I read this time is joseph smith translated this in the earlier 1800 which haad a very different culture than we have now. In a New testiment class we discussed howthe culture and issues of the days very much determine how Pauls letters should be intrepeted. This can be intereted many different ways, but it should be used with modern dayy revelation to make sure the intreretation of such things are right.npm

It is all though out pauls letters and herre is well, when they think they are in the last days, but clearly 2000 years latter that the end was not as close as they thought. content.scripture: 3 Him would Paul have to go forth with him; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters: for they knew all that his father was a Greek.
content.description: We just got through the chapters that said circumsicion was not necassary, but Pual has Timothy circumsiced any way. ? This is an example of helping the people understand. In this case helping the Jews listen without conversity of circumcision, since Christ not circumsision is their main message.

Paul starts where they are and teches from there. He starts with the fact they are religious and are already wordhipping an $unknown god$. Building on this he declares this unknown god they are worshipping is God, but does correct them for using idols
To be the most effective missionaries we must be willing to give our whole soul to the work. This I feel goes well with 1 Corinthians 13 as charity goes with everything.

The words as oft say that everytime we seek forgiveness with real intent we may be forgiven. This scripture is for those who arre already members of the church. We can be forgiven even if we fall short of our coventents
Paul, like Christ and other prophets teach that we should forgive everyone. Here Paul uses charity for the transgressor as the reasaon to forgive, but the princpple of forgive always still stands.
This is a good example of prophet being a wise steward, no body die, but it was still unwise to have set sail as they ended up in stranded on an island

I love that even though this is the last letter that Pual right, and he is a leader of the church, he still has the humlility that he can learn from others. We need to be humble just like that so that we can learn until the time we die.

These scriptures are often used to humble us to know that every calling of the lord is important. I think It can be broder than that. Like some have the gift to be happy, righteous or ful of faith. We need to do less judging each other and just try to help each other with that gift.

At the end of verse 27, there is an assigned punishment for sin, in this case same-gender fornicaiton, there are direct concquences for that sin. In 28, it paints a picture that god lets those punishments happen to people, meaning he could prevent them. We need to choose righteously and pray for help in overcominig the concquences of sin
We are all one in christ jew and gentils with christ being the key corner stone. The context is that paul is saying to jews and gentiales are one.
The body of christ. We are all one in christ and we should use are gifts to help one another as this is way they are given to stregthen christ
I love that we should not only give but we should be excited to give, then in verse 8 that christ gave all so we too should be willing to give all

content.scripture: 15 Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another;)
content.description: This in the New Revised Standard Version, reads clear, but It fits with with the book of mormon when it says by the laws ye have those are the law you will be judged by. out of these
s will they be judged

content.scripture: 3 And it came to pass that he was obedient unto the word of the Lord, wherefore he did as the Lord commanded him.
content.description: The scripure points out the Lehi was in the state of obediance therefore he was obediant to this commandment. I beleive that we need to reach this state of obediance in our own lives

This is what I got out of the armor of god this time. The whole armor of god. It is our faith and our commitment to righteousness that stops the fiery darts of the advesary. It saves us from commiting sin. The feet must be prepared to move and share the gospel. This is how we move forward in the gospel and avoid temptations. The helment is of salvation, meaning we our thoughts and words focused on salvation through christ. And we should have truth at our core with the belt of truth

What a great scriputre one how christians should treat each other. WE should all be of one mind any way and that mind is no ones, but is christ. This illistrates also how christ is the perferct example in humility for us.
This is where we get the 13th Article of faith. You can say we follow the teachings of Paul. Cross Referance all good things come from God
I love this chapter, how can we have that understanding and that much gratitude unto the lord our god

I think this is verse does a very good job of explaining the role that the law of moses played in the history of the jews. I like wise think there is a paralelle between the role every single commandment plays in point us to Jesus Christ. I believe that as we follow the commandments it points our souls to him.

This is a story about the scattering and gathering of Israel. It is intresting to note that if the lord had not scattered Israel all of Israels "fruit" would have been lost. The Lord scattered them because he loves them.

I few thought on the background of this scripture. One i beleive it is actually intresting that he was not forgiven before this point. He had not prayed and recieved confirmation on the prayer. Maybe it has to do with several things that he was finally able to hear the lords response. Maybe he went to a special place? maybe it was quite? maybe he prayed with enough effort to warrent  response? maybe he finally took time to listen? Regardless why now or what he did to get the response, he was forgiven for his faith in Christ!

These verses it it clear that Jehovah is talking but at the beginning of 7 it says the spirit is talking. This is confirming what we have been taught in the modern day that most of the time Heavenly father and Jesus Christ speak through the spirit, even to apostles and prophets.
Just when you think their is no forgiveness because you are are grasped with the chains of hell. It is only when your dead that it is everlastingly to late.

Christ is patience enough to save both Alma and Paul. HE is patient enough to save us all. In fact according to this scripure that is one of the reasons we ehave the record of pauls conversion and back story is so we know how far forgiveness reaches to those who do indeed repent.
